conclusion: Liquid starts flowing from points A, B, and C at the top.
Liquid from A, B, and C combines into a single stream as it flows downwards.
First baffle is orange on the left, angled downwards from left to right.
Combined stream passes to the right of the first orange baffle.
Stream flows between a group of baffles on the left (white and purple) and a yellow baffle on the right.
White and purple baffles are angled downwards from right to left. Yellow baffle is angled downwards from left to right.
Liquid flows through the gap between these baffles.
Stream, after passing the upper baffles, is directed towards the lower part of the setup.
Stream is shown flowing towards the left side of the bottom area.
Container on the left side of the bottom area is labeled D. Container on the right side is labeled E.
Stream of liquid is clearly flowing into container D.
